text: that's a massive Adi coma sempre just
Alamo teetotaler venti
we arrived at the apartment and as
always we were ready for anything
because with these house calls you can
expect the robbery and attack scam
targeting the elderly because we get a
lot of those but actually when we
arrived we just saw this old couple
sitting at the table quietly hand in
hand the man was crying and moaning
saying things like we don't feel well we
thought he was in pain that there was
something physically wrong with him so
he asked him has there been a break-in
have you hurt yourself but his wife said
no you just feel lonely we're sad were
they surprised to see you turn up no
they weren't surprised they saw us and
they looked pleased that someone have
actually come to see them it's hard to
explain really it's almost as if they've
been acting that way to attract
someone's attention and is that why you
decided to stick around and you cook
them dinner is that right yes that's
right we'd call the paramedics to the
house as a matter of course just to make
sure that they were both okay and as
soon as they assured us that there was
nothing physically wrong with them they
left and so once they left I asked the
lady what the problem really was she
looked at me and her eyes were filled
with tears and she said that the problem
is that we feel lonely we feel sad I'm
87 and my husband is 94 so he said look
madam it's 8:30
it's dinner time seeing as the
paramedics have said that you're fine
why don't you just relax watch some
television have some dinner but the lady
said to me look to be honest we don't
even have the will to eat we can't
manage it our loneliness has meant that
we can't even cook anymore so we're just
going to eat this bunch of grapes for
our dinner
they had this bunch of shriveled up
grapes on their table so my colleagues
said madam a bunch of grapes isn't
enough for dinner you should be eating
something more substantial so he went
into the kitchen and found some
spaghetti
as a joke he said madam if you like
we'll make you some dinner
but as soon as they heard this they
practically ran into the kitchen sat
down at the table and said yes we'd love
you well we've all got grandparents
we're all grandsons so as soon as we saw
this it sort of broke our heart so we
said sure so we made them some spaghetti
with a bit of butter and a bit of cheese
I'm intrigued though as to why this
couple felt so lonely I mean not only
have they got each other but also the
impression we have outside Italy is that
families look after their grandparents
the elderly members of their family why
do you think they felt so alone because
actually there's a family issue here
economically they're fine but they've
only got one son and he's got some
serious health problems so he's not able
to look after them in their old age and
besides that we're in the month of
August now which accentuates the
problems that the elderly face here it's
so hot that no one leaves the house no
one comes to visit and there aren't any
neighbors around because in Rome
everybody needs the city in August to go
on holiday so their entire building was
practically empty
so you glad you stepped in to help him
and I imagine it must make quite a
difference to your usual working day
what violence corruption dealing with
the Mafia yes because we as policemen in
Italy in Rome we expect something much
worse than this robberies all kinds of
things so to end up doing something like
this it made it a fantastic day really
spectacular it made us feel good and
what's more this episode has brought a
lot of visibility to this sort of thing
in Italy and now we've seen lots of
people in Rome across Italy in fact who
volunteered to start helping the elderly
who are lonely and in need so the final
outcome was brilliant
